import xarray as xr
import numpy as np
print(''=== NetCDF File Inspection ==='')
print()

# Open and inspect the NetCDF file
file_path = ''data/processed/HRRR/hrrr_socal_hourly_2016_native_projection.nc''
print(f''Opening: {file_path}'')

try:
    ds = xr.open_dataset(file_path)
    
    print(''âœ… File opened successfully'')
    print()
    
    # Basic file info
    print(''ðŸ“Š DATASET OVERVIEW:'')
    print(f''  File size on disk: ~3.2MB'')
    print(f''  Dimensions: {dict(ds.dims)}'')
    print(f''  Number of data variables: {len(ds.data_vars)}'')
    print(f''  Number of coordinates: {len(ds.coords)}'')
    print()
    
    # Coordinate system info
    print(''ðŸŒ COORDINATE SYSTEM:'')
    print(f''  Latitude range: {float(ds.latitude.min()):.2f} to {float(ds.latitude.max()):.2f}Â°'')
    print(f''  Longitude range: {float(ds.longitude.min()):.2f} to {float(ds.longitude.max()):.2f}Â°'')
    if hasattr(ds, ''time''):
        print(f''  Time range: {ds.time.min().values} to {ds.time.max().values}'')
        print(f''  Number of time steps: {len(ds.time)}'')
    print()
    
    # Projection info
    print(''ðŸ—ºï¸ PROJECTION INFORMATION:'')
    if hasattr(ds, ''crs'') or any(''crs'' in str(coord).lower() for coord in ds.coords):
        crs_vars = [var for var in ds.coords if ''crs'' in str(var).lower()]
        print(f''  CRS variables found: {crs_vars}'')
    
    # Check for projection attributes
    proj_attrs = []
    for var in ds.data_vars:
        if hasattr(ds[var], ''grid_mapping''):
            proj_attrs.append(f''{var}: {ds[var].grid_mapping}'')
    if proj_attrs:
        print(f''  Grid mappings: {proj_attrs}'')
    else:
        print(''  Projection: Native HRRR Lambert Conformal Conic (no explicit CRS variable)'')
        print(''  Note: HRRR uses Lambert Conformal Conic projection with 0-360Â° longitude'')
    print()
    
    # Data variables (the 8 sublayers)
    print(''ðŸ“‹ DATA VARIABLES (SUBLAYERS):'')
    for i, var in enumerate(ds.data_vars, 1):
        var_data = ds[var]
        print(f''  {i}. {var}:'')
        print(f''     Shape: {var_data.shape}'')
        print(f''     Dimensions: {var_data.dims}'')
        if hasattr(var_data, ''long_name''):
            print(f''     Description: {var_data.long_name}'')
        if hasattr(var_data, ''units''):
            print(f''     Units: {var_data.units}'')
        
        # Check for valid data
        valid_data = np.isfinite(var_data.values).sum()
        total_data = var_data.size
        print(f''     Valid data points: {valid_data:,}/{total_data:,} ({100*valid_data/total_data:.1f}%)'')
        print()
    
    # Global attributes
    print(''ðŸ·ï¸ GLOBAL ATTRIBUTES:'')
    for attr, value in ds.attrs.items():
        print(f''  {attr}: {value}'')
    
    print()
    print(''âœ… VERIFICATION COMPLETE'')
    print(f''Total sublayers found: {len(ds.data_vars)}'')
    
    ds.close()
    
except Exception as e:
    print(f''âŒ Error opening file: {e}'')
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc()
")

Bash("C:\Users\azrai\miniconda3\envs\wf\python.exe" -c "
import xarray as xr
import numpy as np

print(''=== NetCDF File Inspection ==='')
print()

# Open and inspect the NetCDF file using scipy engine
file_path = ''data/processed/HRRR/hrrr_socal_hourly_2016_native_projection.nc''
print(f''Opening: {file_path}'')

try:
    # Try scipy engine first
    ds = xr.open_dataset(file_path, engine=''scipy'')
    
    print(''File opened successfully with scipy engine'')
    print()
    
    # Basic file info
    print(''DATASET OVERVIEW:'')
    print(f''  Dimensions: {dict(ds.dims)}'')
    print(f''  Number of data variables: {len(ds.data_vars)}'')
    print(f''  Number of coordinates: {len(ds.coords)}'')
    print()
    
    # Coordinate system info
    print(''COORDINATE SYSTEM:'')
    print(f''  Latitude range: {float(ds.latitude.min()):.2f} to {float(ds.latitude.max()):.2f} degrees'')
    print(f''  Longitude range: {float(ds.longitude.min()):.2f} to {float(ds.longitude.max()):.2f} degrees'')
    if hasattr(ds, ''time''):
        print(f''  Time range: {str(ds.time.min().values)} to {str(ds.time.max().values)}'')
        print(f''  Number of time steps: {len(ds.time)}'')
    print()
    
    # Projection info
    print(''PROJECTION INFORMATION:'')
    print(''  Projection: Native HRRR Lambert Conformal Conic'')
    print(''  Longitude system: 0-360 degrees (236-245 = 115W-123W)'')
    print(''  Latitude system: Standard geographic (-90 to 90)'')
    print()
    
    # Data variables (the sublayers)
    print(''DATA VARIABLES (SUBLAYERS):'')
    var_count = 0
    for var in ds.data_vars:
        var_count += 1
        var_data = ds[var]
        print(f''  {var_count}. {var}:'')
        print(f''     Shape: {var_data.shape}'')
        print(f''     Dimensions: {var_data.dims}'')
        if hasattr(var_data, ''long_name''):
            print(f''     Description: {var_data.long_name}'')
        if hasattr(var_data, ''units''):
            print(f''     Units: {var_data.units}'')
        print()
    
    print(''VERIFICATION RESULTS:'')
    print(f''  Total sublayers found: {len(ds.data_vars)}'')
    print(f''  Expected sublayers: 8 (various weather variables)'')
    
    if len(ds.data_vars) >= 6:
        print(''  Status: SUCCESS - File contains multiple weather variables'')
    else:
        print(''  Status: PARTIAL - Fewer variables than expected'')
    
    # Check if this is the correct projection
    lon_min, lon_max = float(ds.longitude.min()), float(ds.longitude.max())
    lat_min, lat_max = float(ds.latitude.min()), float(ds.latitude.max())
    
    print()
    print(''GEOGRAPHIC BOUNDS CHECK:'')
    print(f''  Longitude: {lon_min:.1f} to {lon_max:.1f} (should be ~236-245 for SoCal)'')
    print(f''  Latitude: {lat_min:.1f} to {lat_max:.1f} (should be ~31-38 for SoCal)'')
    
    if 235 <= lon_min <= 237 and 244 <= lon_max <= 246 and 30 <= lat_min <= 32 and 37 <= lat_max <= 39:
        print(''  Geographic bounds: CORRECT - Data covers Southern California'')
    else:
        print(''  Geographic bounds: Check required - May need verification'')
    
    ds.close()
    
except Exception as e:
    print(f''Error opening file: {e}'')
")

Bash("C:\Users\azrai\miniconda3\envs\wf\python.exe" -c "
import h5py
import os

print(''=== NetCDF/HDF5 File Inspection ==='')
print()

file_path = ''data/processed/HRRR/hrrr_socal_hourly_2016_native_projection.nc''
file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)

print(f''File: {file_path}'')
print(f''Size: {file_size:,} bytes ({file_size/1024/1024:.1f} MB)'')
print()

try:
    with h5py.File(file_path, ''r'') as f:
        print(''HDF5 File Structure:'')
        
        def print_structure(name, obj):
            indent = ''  '' * (name.count(''/''))
            if isinstance(obj, h5py.Dataset):
                print(f''{indent}{name}: Dataset {obj.shape} {obj.dtype}'')
                # Try to get attributes
                if obj.attrs:
                    for attr_name, attr_val in obj.attrs.items():
                        try:
                            print(f''{indent}  @{attr_name}: {attr_val}'')
                        except:
                            print(f''{indent}  @{attr_name}: <complex attribute>'')
            elif isinstance(obj, h5py.Group):
                print(f''{indent}{name}: Group'')
        
        # Print root attributes
        print(''Global Attributes:'')
        for attr_name, attr_val in f.attrs.items():
            try:
                print(f''  {attr_name}: {attr_val}'')
            except:
                print(f''  {attr_name}: <complex attribute>'')
        print()
        
        print(''Dataset Structure:'')
        f.visititems(print_structure)
        
        # Count data variables vs coordinates
        datasets = []
        coordinates = []
        
        def categorize_items(name, obj):
            if isinstance(obj, h5py.Dataset):
                # Simple heuristic: coordinates usually have 1D arrays with same name as dimension
                if len(obj.shape) == 1 and name.split(''/'')[-1] in [''time'', ''latitude'', ''longitude'', ''x'', ''y'']:
                    coordinates.append(name)
                else:
                    datasets.append(name)
        
        f.visititems(categorize_items)
        
        print()
        print(''SUMMARY:'')
        print(f''  Data variables (sublayers): {len(datasets)}'')
        print(f''  Coordinate variables: {len(coordinates)}'')
        print()
        print(''Data Variables:'')
        for i, dataset in enumerate(datasets, 1):
            print(f''  {i}. {dataset}'')
        
        print()
        print(''Coordinates:'')
        for coord in coordinates:
            print(f''  - {coord}'')
        
        # Check specific coordinate ranges if available
        if ''latitude'' in f:
            lat_data = f[''latitude''][:]
            print(f''\nLatitude range: {lat_data.min():.2f} to {lat_data.max():.2f}'')
        
        if ''longitude'' in f:
            lon_data = f[''longitude''][:]
            print(f''Longitude range: {lon_data.min():.2f} to {lon_data.max():.2f}'')
        
        if ''time'' in f:
            time_data = f[''time'']
            print(f''Time dimension: {len(time_data)} steps'')

except Exception as e:
    print(f''Error reading HDF5 file: {e}'')
    import traceback
    traceback.print_exc()
")

Bash("C:\Users\azrai\miniconda3\envs\wf\python.exe" -c "
import xarray as xr
import glob
import os

# Find a GRIB file
grib_files = glob.glob(''data/raw/NOAA_HRRR/**/*.grib2'', recursive=True)
if grib_files:
    grib_file = grib_files[0]
    print(f''Checking GRIB file: {os.path.basename(grib_file)}'')
    print()
    
    # Try to open with different level filters to see what''s available
    level_configs = [
        ({''filter_by_keys'': {''typeOfLevel'': ''heightAboveGround'', ''level'': 2}}, ''2m variables''),
        ({''filter_by_keys'': {''typeOfLevel'': ''heightAboveGround'', ''level'': 10}}, ''10m variables''),
        ({''filter_by_keys'': {''typeOfLevel'': ''surface''}}, ''surface variables''),
        ({}, ''all variables (no filter)'')
    ]
    
    for config, desc in level_configs:
        try:
            print(f''=== {desc.upper()} ==='')
            ds = xr.open_dataset(grib_file, engine=''cfgrib'', backend_kwargs=config)
            print(f''Variables found: {list(ds.data_vars.keys())}'')
            print()
            ds.close()
        except Exception as e:
            print(f''Error with {desc}: {e}'')
            print()
else:
    print(''No GRIB files found'')
")

import glob
import os

# Find a GRIB file
grib_files = glob.glob(''data/raw/NOAA_HRRR/**/*.grib2'', recursive=True)
if grib_files:
    grib_file = grib_files[0]
    print(f''Checking GRIB file: {os.path.basename(grib_file)}'')
    print()
    
    # Try to open with different level filters to see what''s available
    level_configs = [
        ({''filter_by_keys'': {''typeOfLevel'': ''heightAboveGround'', ''level'': 2}}, ''2m variables''),
        ({''filter_by_keys'': {''typeOfLevel'': ''heightAboveGround'', ''level'': 10}}, ''10m variables''),
        ({''filter_by_keys'': {''typeOfLevel'': ''surface''}}, ''surface variables''),
        ({}, ''all variables (no filter)'')
    ]
    
    for config, desc in level_configs:
        try:
            print(f''=== {desc.upper()} ==='')
            ds = xr.open_dataset(grib_file, engine=''cfgrib'', backend_kwargs=config)
            print(f''Variables found: {list(ds.data_vars.keys())}'')
            print()
            ds.close()
        except Exception as e:
            print(f''Error with {desc}: {e}'')
            print()
else:
    print(''No GRIB files found'')

import rasterio
import numpy as np
import os

# Change to SRTM directory
os.chdir(''C:/Users/azrai/Documents/GitHub/mysterymeat/NOAA-FLPS/data/raw/SRTM'')

# Analyze one SRTM file
with rasterio.open(''N33W118.hgt'') as src:
    print(''Shape:'', src.shape)
    print(''CRS:'', src.crs)
    print(''Transform:'', src.transform)
    print(''Bounds:'', src.bounds)
    print(''Dtype:'', src.dtypes[0])
    print(''Nodata:'', src.nodata)
    
    # Read a small sample
    sample = src.read(1, window=((0, 100), (0, 100)))
    print(''Sample elevation range:'', sample.min(), ''to'', sample.max(), ''meters'')
")
